course_title: Special Topics:African Studies: African Women's History
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 10 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as HIST 385 1, WGS 385 2)
African women's history is rich and layered. In this seminar, we will examine the different roles women have occupied in the African past. We will consider social, political, economic, religious, and cultural experiences of women, including North and Sub-Saharan Africa. We will read primary and secondary sources, with the goal of understanding historical changes and problematizing ahistorical gender analysis. Much of our reading and discussion will focus on the pre-1900 period. Gender will be a central concept, since we will consider women's interactions with men and children. This seminar is concerned with the historical forces shaping African women's lives, as well as with the ways in which women have been active historical agents. Student will work on individual research project.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
